body_html:
Medium has a guest article (probably written by one of the contributors here) that shows a patch procedure to fix the eigen stuff. Also said to checkout 1.11 before build. Trying it now... Ok it looks like it works... waiting for rest of compilation.

IT WORKS!!!
In summary, if you are someone with a brand spankin' new RTX card and want compute 7.5, Cuda 10, and Cudnn 7.3, this is what you need to know:

  • Python 3.7 doesn't work because protobuf causes compiler errors
  • Python 3.6.6 works. Anaconda supports making environments, you can make and choose 3.6 and leave your 3.7 one alone until the protobuf stuff is fixed. Note building with 3.6 means incompatible with 3.7. Hope this gets fixed.
  • Compute 7.5 (and anything above 5.3 I believe) requires patching eigen stuff, so follow this guide to patch it.
  • I think you need to checkout the v1.11 of tensorflow before anything also. Not sure, didn't test not doing it.

IT WORKS!!!
In summary, if you are someone with a brand spankin' new RTX card and want compute 7.5, Cuda 10, and Cudnn 7.3, this is what you need to know:

Python 3.7 doesn't work because protobuf causes compiler errors
Python 3.6.6 works. Anaconda supports making environments, you can make and choose 3.6 and leave your 3.7 one alone until the protobuf stuff is fixed. Note building with 3.6 means incompatible with 3.7. Hope this gets fixed.
Compute 7.5 (and anything above 5.3 I believe) requires patching eigen stuff, so follow this guide to patch it.
I think you need to checkout the v1.11 of tensorflow before anything also. Not sure, didn't test not doing it.
body:
Medium has a [guest article](https://medium.com/@amsokol.com/update-1-how-to-build-and-install-tensorflow-gpu-cpu-for-windows-from-source-code-using-bazel-and-c2e86fec9ef2) (probably written by one of the contributors here) that shows a patch procedure to fix the eigen stuff. Also said to `checkout` 1.11 before build. Trying it now... Ok it looks like it works... waiting for rest of compilation.

IT WORKS!!!
In summary, if you are someone with a brand spankin' new RTX card and want compute 7.5, Cuda 10, and Cudnn 7.3, this is what you need to know:

- Python 3.7 doesn't work because `protobuf` causes compiler errors
- Python 3.6.6 works. Anaconda supports [making environments](https://conda.io/docs/user-guide/tasks/manage-python.html), you can make and choose 3.6 and leave your 3.7 one alone until the `protobuf` stuff is fixed. Note building with 3.6 means incompatible with 3.7. Hope this gets fixed.
- Compute 7.5 (and anything above 5.3 I believe) requires patching `eigen` stuff, so follow [this guide](https://medium.com/@amsokol.com/update-1-how-to-build-and-install-tensorflow-gpu-cpu-for-windows-from-source-code-using-bazel-and-c2e86fec9ef2) to patch it.
- I think you need to `checkout` the v1.11 of tensorflow before anything also. Not sure, didn't test not doing it.
